tooltip_html: Total military personnel (both sides, Pacific Theater) est.: ~6.5–8.5 million (Allied + Japanese combined). Total aircraft (end-1945) est.: ~60,000 (Pacific-assigned inventory). Total major warships (end-1945) est.: ~2,500 (all navies). Sources: U.S. National WWII Museum (troop and theater overviews), U.S. Navy historical center fleet lists, Britannica/Pearl Harbor & Pacific operations. (see: https://www.nationalww2museum.org, https://www.history.navy.mil, https://www.britannica.com)

Total military personnel (both sides, Pacific Theater) est.: ~5.2–7.0 million. Total aircraft (end-1944) est.: ~45,000. Total major warships (end-1944) est.: ~2,000. Sources: U.S. War Department histories; U.S. Navy; Britannica. (est.)

Total military personnel (both sides, Pacific Theater) est.: ~4.0–5.5 million. Total aircraft (end-1943) est.: ~30,000. Total major warships (end-1943) est.: ~1,700. Sources: Official histories & naval inventories (est.)

Total military personnel (both sides, Pacific Theater) est.: ~2.0–4.0 million. Total aircraft (end-1942) est.: ~12,000. Total major warships (end-1942) est.: ~1,200. Sources: Navy/Army historical records (est.)

Total military personnel (both sides, Pacific Theater) est.: ~1.5–2.5 million. Total aircraft (end-1941) est.: ~8,000. Total major warships (end-1941) est.: ~900. Sources: Pre-war & 1941 inventories; official navy/air historical sources (est.)
